result.execSummary:
The defendant Rachale A. Faulkner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 2.
Any violation of ES shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's ES.
DE is eligible for the SAP - only after the DE has completed serving 50% of her sentence..  DE is not eligible for the CIP.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Joint & severally w/ co-defts in cases 22CF323/324
***DA TO SUBMITTED RESTITUTION PAPERWORK***

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Counseling shall specifically include: AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
* Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
* Pay restitution in the sum of $1040.00 plus surcharges.   Joint & Severally wo co-defts in 22CF323/22CF324.
May not have contact with Carl C or Harold F except for any family law cases pertaining tot children/divorce, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any violation of ES/probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the De's ES/probation.

Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

2:53 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rachale A. Faulkner in court, in custody.  Attorney David Rudolph Berman in court for Rachale A. Faulkner. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Berman places a correction to the PSI report on the record. Sentencing arguments heard. 
Count 1: Defendant is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP; 4 years Initial Confinement with credit for 213 days followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision- concurrent to count 2. Conditions are no contact with Carl C. or Harold F. (except for any family law cases pertaining to divorce or children). Any violation of ES shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's ES. Restitution in the amount of $1,040 joint and severally w/ co-defendants in cases 22CF323/22CF324. DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program- only after the DE has completed serving 50% of her sentence.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

Count 2: Defendant is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP; 4 years Initial Confinement with credit for 213 days followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision- concurrent to count 1. Conditions are no contact with Carl C. or Harold F. (except for any family law cases pertaining to divorce or children). Any violation of ES shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's ES. Restitution in the amount of $1,040 joint and severally w/ co-defendants in cases 22CF323/22CF324. DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program- only after the DE has completed serving 50% of her sentence.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

Count 7: Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions consecutive to counts 1 & 2. No contact with Carl C. or Harold F. (except for any family law cases pertaining to divorce or children). Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. No sentence credit.

Court costs, Drug surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant. Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Joint services $2.52 records requested by advocate counsel. Add to atty fees

11:18 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Rachale A. Faulkner, appeared in custody with Attorney David Rudolph Berman.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Matter is resolved. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 1, 2 and 7; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 3-6 are dismissed and read in. Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney David Rudolph Berman in court with Defendant Rachale A. Faulkner who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU
   Minutes:  Co-Deft withdrew his speedy trial demand and next hearing remains as scheduled on 8/11/22.
